lines.text: Papa, I'm afraid! I wanna go home! What's gonna happen to us?
Well, something good, son, as easily as something else. Why, anything can happen.
But it won't! Not this evening, my lads!
Two innocents abroad, eh? But for me, you'd be flattened to a fare-thee-well.
I wanna go home.
The very place I had in mind. Come on, now, my lovelies, I'm taking you home.
We're going back to the toy shop?
I don't think that's the home he's talking about.

[after witnessing Ralphie dismantle the donkey]
That was horrible!
You're a bad rat!
You noticed?
It's been very slow, boss. These are hard times for oracles.
For incompetent ones.
Are you sayin' that my charms don't work? That my potions don't heal? That my fortunes are false?
Of course. That's why I hired you.
Frog, you're fired!
For bein' a fraud?
For being a failure *as* a fraud!

[talking to himself]
Now, let's see, first thing, I go, uh, in the morning I go to the, um, uh, the guard!
No, the manager.
Son, don't help him. They'll make us thieves soon enough.
Tell you your fortune? Give me your palm.

[indicating their permanently linked hands]
We don't have one.
Can't read your hand. Well, no matter, I'll just read your feet.
Their feet?
An ancient form of divination taught to me by the praying mantis of the Babylonian persuasion.
What would you have from the future? It could be anything you like.
I want the Elephant to be my mama.
You what - ?
And the Seal to be my sister. And we'll all live together in the toy store.
An elephant? That's rather a large order. And you?
I don't want anything given to me. I want something taken away.
What's that?
Our key. The world being what it is, we'd be better off if we were free to wind ourselves.
Aw, go ahead, I need a minute to think anyway.
At least.
Those wind-ups will wind up scrap!

[underwater]
Please, take us to the surface
...And wind us up
Wind you up? Hm'... In what sense?
